meanings.definition: Fastened or fixed firmly in place.
meanings.sent1: The rivetted metal beams held the structure together securely.
meanings.sent2: The rivetted sign on the door indicated it was closed.
meanings.sent3: The rivetted squirrel statue in the garden seemed to be guarding the flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were rivetted on the breathtaking sunset, unable to look away.
meanings.sent5: The rivetted lock on the treasure chest kept its contents safe from prying hands.

meanings.sent1: The rivetted audience couldn't take their eyes off the magician's tricks.
meanings.sent2: She was rivetted by the suspenseful plot of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The rivetted cat stared intently at the moving laser pointer on the wall.
meanings.sent4: His attention was rivetted on the fascinating book, oblivious to the passing time.
meanings.sent5: The rivetted child listened with wonder to the storyteller's tales of dragons and knights.
